selectionMeta.selectedSenseLabelKo: 혼자서는 안 된다, 양쪽 다 책임이 있다

step1.sentence: You can't blame only one side for the breakdown — it takes two to tango.

step2.story: The mediation session began with both parties explaining why the other was entirely responsible for the failed partnership. The mediator listened patiently, then said simply: it takes two to tango. The room went quiet. Real progress started after that.

step3.story: The post-mortem on the failed product launch identified a list of contributing factors across multiple teams. The initial reaction in each department was to point at the others. The project director printed the full list on a single page and distributed it without commentary. Every team was on it. She said one sentence before the discussion began: it takes two to tango, and in this case it took ten. The meeting shifted from defense to analysis, and the document that came out of it became the foundation of a much stronger process for the next launch.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 문제나 관계에서 한쪽만의 책임이 아니라 양측 모두에게 책임이 있음을 말할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 탱고는 두 사람이 함께 맞춰야 추는 춤이라는 사실에서 유래했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 비난의 일방성을 지적하며, 상호 책임을 인정하도록 촉구하는 표현입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: It takes two to tango — both parties share the blame.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 탱고는 둘이 춰야 해요 — 양측 모두에게 책임이 있어요.
